SEARCH
Package model

Class Medication

java.lang.Object
model.Medication
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Medication extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a medication in the system. Stores details such as name, stock level, dosage, expiration date, and low stock threshold. Provides methods to manage stock levels and check for low stock or expiration status.
Since:
2024-11-18
Version:
1.0
Author:
Lee Kuan Rong Shane, Lim Wee Keat, Tan Wen Rong

  • Constructor Details

    • Medication

      public Medication(String name, int stockLevel, LocalDate expirationDate, int lowStockThreshold)
      Constructs a Medication object with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the medication.
      stockLevel - The initial stock level of the medication.
      expirationDate - The expiration date of the medication.
      lowStockThreshold - The threshold below which the stock is considered low.

    • Medication

      public Medication(String name, int givenDosage)
      Constructs a Medication object with the specified name and dosage. Useful for scenarios where only the medication name and dosage are needed.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the medication.
      givenDosage - The dosage of the medication.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the medication.
      Returns:
      The name of the medication.

    • getStockLevel

      public int getStockLevel()
      Retrieves the current stock level of the medication.
      Returns:
      The stock level.

    • getDosage

      public int getDosage()
      Retrieves the dosage of the medication.
      Returns:
      The dosage.

    • getLowStockThreshold

      public int getLowStockThreshold()
      Retrieves the low stock threshold of the medication.
      Returns:
      The low stock threshold.

    • setStockLevel

      public void setStockLevel(int stockLevel)
      Sets the stock level of the medication.
      Parameters:
      stockLevel - The new stock level.

    • isStockLow

      public boolean isStockLow()
      Checks if the stock level is below or equal to the low stock threshold.
      Returns:
      true if the stock is low, false otherwise.

    • addStock

      public void addStock(int amount)
      Increases the stock level of the medication by a specified amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount to add to the stock.

    • minusStock

      public void minusStock(int dosage)
      Decreases the stock level of the medication by a specified amount.
      Parameters:
      dosage - The amount to subtract from the stock.

    • getExpirationDate

      public LocalDate getExpirationDate()
      Retrieves the expiration date of the medication.
      Returns:
      The expiration date.

    • setExpirationDate

      public void setExpirationDate(LocalDate expirationDate)
      Sets the expiration date of the medication.
      Parameters:
      expirationDate - The new expiration date.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the medication. Includes name, dosage (if specified), stock level, and low stock threshold. Marks the medication as low stock if the stock level is below the threshold.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the medication.
